intro: Solanum amarantoides var. hirtellum, commonly known as the hairy bitterberry, is a perennial shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green berries that mature to a dark red color. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
